page.title: 08Education
page.content: In the last ten years two nearby primary schools have closed and the children now travel by bus to Brockhampton school on Bromyard Downs or go to Suckley school. Some secondary schoolchildren go to Malvern but most go by bus to Queen Elizabeth school in Bromyard until the age of sixteen. From sixteen to eighteen they can go to the Sixth Form College in Hereford, or they may choose the technical or art colleges in Hereford or Worcester, or the agricultural college at Holme Lacy. Holme Lacy involves a complicated daily bus trip of about sixty miles. There are play schools for the very young at Linley Green, Bishops Frome, and Bromyard. A few parents prefer to send their children to private day or boarding schools. Adult education classes are held in Bromyard and nearby villages.
